alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:17PM EST until December 18 at 3:21PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Caribou ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Piscataquis and Penobscot Counties. Penobscot At Bangor affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot at Bangor. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Bangor Waterfront begins to flood in portions of the riverwalk. Flood control systems and barriers in Kenduskeag Plaza may become stressed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:06 AM EST Monday the stage was 1.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest at 12.0 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.6 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 04/10/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 330 PM EST.
